Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class StringMethods

java.lang.Object
nl.naturalis.common.StringMethods
public final class StringMethods
extends Object
Methods for working with strings. Most methods are friendly towards batch-wise print jobs, trying to make the best of their input. They are are null-safe with respect to the string to be manipulated and they never return null (unless indicated otherwise). The string to be manipulated is named subject and is passed in as an Object. If the argument is null, an empty string is returned. Otherwise manipulation is done on the string resulting from Object.toString.

  • Field Summary

    static String EMPTY
    The empty string.

      substr - The substring to search for

      public static String endsWith​(Object subject, boolean ignoreCase, Collection<String> suffixes)
      Whether or not the provided string ends with any of the provided suffixes. They suffixes must not be null or empty.
      Parameters:
      subject - The string to test
      ignoreCase - Whether or not to ignore case
      suffixes - The suffixes to test
      Returns:
      The first suffix found to be equal to the end of the string, or null if the string ended in none of the provided suffixes

    • endsWith

      ignoreCase - Whether or not to ignore case
      suffixes - The suffixes to test
      Returns:

    • lpad

      public static String lpad​(Object obj, int width)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the space character (' ').
      Parameters:
      obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      Returns:
      The left-padded string

    • lpad

      public static String lpad​(Object obj, int width, char padChar)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the specified padding character.
      Parameters:
      obj - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left-pad the string
      Returns:
      The left-padded string

    • lpad

      public static String lpad​(Object subject, int width, char padChar, String delimiter)
      Left-pads a string to the specified width using the specified padding character and then appends the specified terminator.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is returned without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left-pad the string
      delimiter - A delimiter to append to the padded string. Specify null or an empty string to indicate that no delimiter should be appended.
      Returns:
      The left-padded string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If terminator is null

    • ltrim

      public static String ltrim​(Object subject, char c)
      Left-trims the provided string. The resulting string will not start with the specified character.
      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      c - The character to trim off the String
      Returns:
      The left-trimmed String or the input string if it did not start with the specified character

    • ltrim

      public static String ltrim​(Object subject, String chars)
      Left-trims all characters contained in chars from the provided provided string. The resulting string will not start with any of the charachters contained in chars.
      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      chars - The character to trim off the String
      Returns:
      The left-trimmed String or the input string if it did not start with any of the specified characters

    • pad

      public static String pad​(Object subject, int width, char padChar)
      Centers (left- and right-pads) a string within the specified width using the specified padding character.
      Parameters:
      subject - An object whose toString() method produces the string to be padded. Null is treated as the empty string.
      width - The total length of the padded string. If the string itself is wider than the specified width, the string is printed without padding.
      padChar - The character used to left- and right-pad the string.
      Returns:
      The left- and right-padded string plus the terminator

      Parameters:

      c - The character to trim off the String

      Parameters:
      subject - The String to trim
      chars - The character to trim off the String
      Returns:
      The right-trimmed String or the input string if it did not end with any of the specified characters

    • substring

      public static String substring​(String str, int from)
      Substring method that facilitates substring retrieval relative to the end of a string.

      1. If the input string is empty and from equals zero, an empty string is returned.
      2. If from is negative, it is taken relative to the end of the string.
      Parameters:
      str - The String to extract a substring from
      from - The start index within string (may be negative)
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substring

      public static String substring​(String str, int from, int length)
      Substring method that facilitates substring retrieval relative to the end of a string as well as substring retrieval in the opposite direction. The from and length arguments works as follows:

      1. If from is negative, it is taken relative to the end of the string.
      2. If length is negative, the substring is taken in the opposite direction, with from now becoming the last character of the substring.
      Parameters:
      str - The String to extract a substring from. Must not be null.
      from - The start index within string (may be negative)
      length - The desired length of the substring
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substrFrom

      public static String substrFrom​(String str, String from)
      Returns everything from (and including) the first occurrence of the specified character sequence, or the entire string if it does not contain that character sequence.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to take a substring from
      to - The character sequence from which to take the substring
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substrFrom

      public static String substrFrom​(String str, String from, boolean last)
      Returns everything from (and including) the first or last occurrence of the specified character sequence, or the entire string if it does not contain that character sequence.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to take a substring from
      to - The character sequence from which to take the substring
      last - Whether to use the first of last occurrence of from
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substrTo

      public static String substrTo​(String str, char to)
      Returns everything up to (and not including) the firstoccurrence of the specified character within the string, or the entire string if it does not contain that character.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to take a substring from
      to - The character up to which to take the substring
      last - Whether to use the first of last occurrence of to
      Returns:
      The substring

    • substrTo

      public static String substrTo​(String str, char to, boolean last)
      Returns everything up to (and not including) the first or last occurrence of the specified character within the string, or the entire string if it does not contain that character.
      Parameters:
      str - The string to take a substring from
      to - The character up to which to take the substring
      last - Whether to use the first of last occurrence of to
      Returns:
      The substring
